unnormalised: New Delhi – Air quality in the Indo-Gangetic plain, especially during the winter months, remains a critical environmental concern. Understanding the Air Quality Index (AQI) is crucial. The AQI, monitored by the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB), uses a scale of 0-500, with higher values indicating poorer air quality and greater health risks. Common pollutants include particulate matter (PM2.5 and PM10), nitrogen dioxide (NO2), and ozone (O3).
normalised: New Delhi – Air quality in the Indo-Gangetic plain, especially during the winter months, remains a critical environmental concern. Understanding the Air Quality Index (A Q I) is crucial. The A Q I, monitored by the Central Pollution Control Board (C P C B), uses a scale of zero to five hundred, with higher values indicating poorer air quality and greater health risks. Common pollutants include particulate matter (P M two point five and P M ten), nitrogen dioxide (N O two), and ozone (O three).

unnormalised: Sources of pollution range from vehicular emissions and industrial activities in areas like Okhla Industrial Area to agricultural stubble burning in neighboring states like Haryana and Punjab after the 15/10 harvest. Diwali fireworks, a beloved cultural tradition, also contribute significantly to pollution spikes, particularly around 22:00 hrs on the day of the festival.
normalised: Sources of pollution range from vehicular emissions and industrial activities in areas like Okhla Industrial Area to agricultural stubble burning in neighboring states like Haryana and Punjab after the fifteenth October harvest. unnormalised: Long-term exposure to poor air quality can lead to respiratory illnesses, cardiovascular problems, and other health issues. Initiatives like the National Clean Air Programme (NCAP) aim to reduce particulate matter concentrations by 20-30% by 2024 (base year 2017). The IIT Kanpur is also researching innovative solutions to mitigate pollution. Citizens can contribute by opting for public transport and planting trees, especially native species like Neem and Peepal. Checking the daily AQI forecast at 09:00 hrs before heading out is also recommended.
